Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P3 (bovine cathelicidin, cattle, ruminant, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.25753638] Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus ATCC29213 (MIC=25 μg/ml), Clinical Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=12.5 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria :Escherichia coli ATCC25922 (MIC=12.5 μg/ml), Clinical Escherichia coli (MIC=12.5 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa clinical strain (MIC=25 μg/ml);Fungi :Candida albicans Clinical strain (MIC=25 μg/ml), Candida albicans ATCC 90029 (MIC=50 μg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.25753638] 3% hemolysis at 50 μg/ml , 5% hemolysis  at 100 μg/ml , 7% hemolysis at 200 μg/ml , 7.5% hemolysis at 300 μg/ml , 8% hemolysis at 400 μg/ml against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.25753638] The cell viability of HaCaT cell lines is 93% and 94% at peptide concentrations of 200 and 400 μg/ml. In kumning mice, the LD50 of P3 is 160 mg/kg for i.p. injection, while the LD50 of PMB(served as a control) is 50 mg/kg. No mortality w
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria, Antifungal activity agaist Candida albicans

Literature.Title: Potential of Novel Antimicrobial Peptide P3 from Bovine Erythrocytes and Its Analogs To Disrupt Bacterial Membranes In Vitro and Display Activity against Drug-Resistant Bacteria in a Mouse Model
Literature.Author: Qinghua Zhang, Yanzhao Xu, Qing Wang, Bolin Hang, Yawei Sun, Xiaoxiao Wei, Jianhe Hu
